page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: THERE ARE{THREE}DISTINCT BUILT UP AREAS IN THE BLOCK. {THE STREET},BEING THE MAIN PART OF THE VILLAGE ESTABLISHED IN SAXON TIMES, NOW ONE ROAD WITH WIDE GRASS VERGES.{THE HEATH ,TO THE NORTH,IS AN AREA OF SCATTERED HOUSES AND A COUNCIL ESTATE,DEVELOPED OVER THE YEARS ON THE ORIGINAL COMMON LAND.{READING STREET,} A MILE TO THE WEST HAS A FEW HOUSES AND A CHURCH WHICH ORIGINALLY STOOD ON CHAPEL BANK. THE AREA IS MAINLY RURAL WITH GARAGES AND WORKSHOPS. THE {ROYAL MILITARY {CANAL}DUG AS A NAPOLEONIC DEFENCE IS THE MAIN FEATURE, THE NORTH BANK OF WHICH IS OWNED BY THE NATIONAL TRUST. {
